name: Science and Social Justice II
description: Building on the integrated learning from any New One I course, this course considers the scientific debates and social justice implications of selected contemporary transnational issues such as climate change, pandemics, gender identities, disability, and pharmaceutical research. Research projects allow students to focus on an issue of particular interest.
prerequisites: NEW101H1/NEW102H1/NEW103H1/NEW104H1/NEW105H1, or permission of the New One Coordinator
exclusions: INI, SMC, TRI, UC, VIC, WDW One, Munk One; NEW111H1/NEW112H1/NEW113H1/NEW114H1/NEW115H1
